question:
In the question given below, three sentences are given which may or may not contain an error. Choose the one that is grammatically incorrect.

I. This watch is more expensive of the five watches he has been gifted.

II. Raghav, in my opinion, is humbler than loyal.

III. This watch is the more expensive of the two watches.
solution:
Sentences I and II are incorrect.

I: A comparative degree is used to compare two things. In the given sentence, the superlative degree should be used to talk about one of the five watches.

The correct sentence is: This watch is the most expensive of the five watches he has been gifted.

II: When two qualities in the same person or thing are compared, the comparative degree is formed by using "more", instead of "- r or - er" with the positive. So, 'humbler' should be replaced with 'more humble'.

The correct sentence is: Raghav, in my opinion, is more humble than loyal.

III: When the selection of one of the two persons or things (sets of things) of the same kind is meant, the comparative degree is preceded by 'the' and is followed by 'of'. So, sentence III is correct.

Hence, option (c) is the correct answer.

Note: The Positive Degree is used to denote the mere existence of some quality of what we speak about. It is used when no comparison is made.

The Comparative degree denotes a higher degree of quality than the positive and is used when two things are compared.

The Superlative degree indicates the highest degree of quality and is used when more than two things (or sets of things) are compared.

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given with five highlighted words. Identify the word which is spelt wrongly in the sentence and mark your answer accordingly.

The main concern (A) is that the disagreements (B) could escalate (C) and result in a constitutional deadlock, thereby (D) halting the administarative (E) process.
solution:
'Admininstarative' is not the correct word in the English language. The correct spelling of the word is 'administrative'. It relates to running a business, organisation, etc.

Hence, option d) is correct.

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given with five highlighted words. Identify the word which is spelt wrongly in the sentence and mark your answer accordingly.

Youth were guided (A) by the unwriten (B) and usually unspoken (C) agreement (D) for how to get along in that community (E).
solution:
Among the highlighted words, word (B) 'unwriten' is incorrectly spelt. The correct spelling of the word is 'unwritten' which means 'not recorded in writing'.

Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given with five highlighted words. Identify the word which is spelt wrongly in the sentence and mark your answer accordingly.

There are benefits (A) and boundaries (B) to this social (B) contract; call it perrks (D) and price (E) tags.
solution:
Among the highlighted words, word (D) 'perrks' is incorrectly spelt. The correct spelling of the word is 'perks' which means 'an advantage or benefit arising from a particular situation'.

Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given which is divided into five parts. The part in bold is grammatically correct. Out of the other four parts, one part contains an error. Mark that option as your answer. If none of the parts has errors, mark 'No error' as your answer.

Each of the stages in the/ supply chain model (A)/ have been intelligently designed (B)/ to suit the needs of the customers and (C)/ to ensure seamless delivery of services.(D)
solution:
The error is in part (B). In the given sentence, 'each' acts as an indefinite pronoun. 'Each' is always followed by a singular verb. It does not agree with the plural verb 'have'. 'Have' should be replaced with 'has'.

Option c) is correct.

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given which is divided into five parts. The part in bold is grammatically correct. Out of the other four parts, one part contains an error. Mark that option as your answer. If none of the parts has errors, mark 'No error' as your answer.

The people whom I met yesterday/ turned out to be (A)/ the lead singers of the band (B)/ Rahul and me were (C)/ talking about a few days ago.(D)
solution:
The error is in part (C). The pronoun 'me' is incorrect here. We use the pronoun 'I' when the person speaking is doing the action, either alone or with someone else. We use the pronoun 'me' when the person speaking is receiving the action of the verb in some way, either directly or indirectly. In the given sentence, the pronoun should be the subject (doer). Thus 'me' should be replaced with 'I'.

Option d) is correct.

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given which is divided into five parts. The part in bold is grammatically correct. Out of the other four parts, one part contains an error. Mark that option as your answer. If none of the parts has errors, mark 'No error' as your answer.

Whoever the business magnate (A)/ signs the electric vehicle deal/ with is going to (B)/ become a millionaire (C)/ in the next five years.(D)
solution:
The error is in part (A). 'Whoever' should be replaced with 'whomever'. 'Whoever' is a subjective pronoun. It serves as a subject of a verb. 'Whomever' is an objective pronoun. It serves as an object of a verb or a preposition.

Option b) is correct.

question:
In the following question, a sentence is given which is divided into five parts. The part in bold is grammatically correct. Out of the other four parts, one part contains an error. Mark that option as your answer. If none of the parts has errors, mark 'No error' as your answer.

The new priest at the church told me that (A)/ he began practising the religion/ when one of his best friends (B)/ died from cancer (C)/ a few years ago.(D)
solution:
The error is in part (C). We use 'died of' whenever a disease is involved.

"He died of heart attack" for example.

We use 'died from' for other numerous reasons.

For example: She died from falling off the stairs.

He died from fatigue/exhaustion/heat/cold/hunger.

'Died from' should be replaced with 'died of'.

Option d) is correct.

question:
Which of the following phrases (A), (B), and (C) given below the sentence should replace the phrase printed in bold to make the sentence grammatically correct? Choose the best option among the five given alternatives that reflects the correct phrase(s) to be used in the sentence.

Despite of having a broken leg, his doctor never stopped him from doing anything challenging.

A. Nevertheless he

B. Despite having

C. Though he has
solution:
'Despite' is not followed by 'of' as it means 'in spite of' so the use of 'of' is superfluous. Though means despite the fact that; although. Here, the sentence denotes a contrast that he has a broken leg and still his doctor does not stop him from doing anything challenging. So, both B and C can be used as a replacement.

In A, there is no verb to complete the sentence structure (subject+ verb+ object). So, it cannot be used here.

Hence, option (c) is correct.

question:
Which of the following phrases (A), (B), and (C) given below the sentence should replace the phrase printed in bold to make the sentence grammatically correct? Choose the best option among the five given alternatives that reflects the correct phrase(s) to be used in the sentence.

Unsurprisingly, reports is emerging about patients whose conditions have been deteriorating rapidly.

A. are emerging

B. is prominent

C. are coming out
solution:
'Reports' is a plural noun so it should be followed by a plural verb. So, 'are' should be used here. This makes option (b) incorrect. In A and C, 'are emerging' and 'are coming out' explains that that the reports are coming into view to indicate the condition of the patients.

Hence, option (d) is correct.

question:
In the following question, three sentences are given, which may or may not be correct grammatically or contextually. Mark the option as your answer, which contains the sentence(s) that is/are grammatically or contextually incorrect.

A. Regardless of the role and industry, having solid technical skills can boost your job prospects.

B. Stretching can feel like a hassle, but it is crucial to prevent injury and maintaining a good range of mobility.

C. My mother's house is full of drawers of mismatched crystal wine goblets and silverware.
solution:
In sentence 'B', the verb 'maintaining' is grammatically incorrect. The clauses 'to prevent injury' and 'maintaining a good range of mobility' are similar and should have the same verb form. This is the parallelism rule. The verbal phrase 'to prevent' is in the infinitive form. The verb 'maintaining' is in present participle form. It should also be in the infinitive form. Thus, 'maintaining' should be replaced by 'to maintain'.

Sentences 'A' and 'C' have no errors.

Note: - Parallelism: In grammar, parallelism, also known as parallel structure or parallel construction, is a balance within one or more sentences of similar phrases or clauses that have the same grammatical structure. Given below is an example which shows a sentence in two forms (parallel in structure and lacking parallelism): Lacking parallelism: Prerna likes cooking, dancing and to sing. Parallel: Prerna likes cooking, dancing and singing.

Infinitive: The infinitive is the base form of a verb, often preceded by to.

Consider the sentences given below:

· To err is human. [like a noun, the infinitive 'to err' is the subject of the verb 'is']

· My father likes to cook. [like a noun, the infinitive 'to cook' is the object of the verb 'likes']

· To vote in elections is our right. [the infinitive 'to vote', like a noun, is the subject of the verb 'is', but, like a verb, it also takes an object (elections)]

· Radha went to the lake to fetch water. [the infinitive 'to fetch', like a noun, is the object of the verb 'went', but, like a verb, it also takes an object (water)]

· The above sentences illustrate various ways in which infinitives are used. It can both act as a noun and a verb.

Hence, the answer is option b).

question:
Which of the following phrases can replace the phrase in bold so as to make the statement correct? If the statement does not need any correction, mark 'No correction required' as your answer.

Needless to say, stress is one of the most notorious silent killers on our times.

(i) vicious killers on our times

(ii) deadly killers of our times

(iii) ravishing killers on our times
solution:
The preposition 'on' does not correctly establish the relationship between 'killers' and 'times' as it is used to talk about an object that is placed on the surface of another object which is not the case here. Thus 'of' must replace 'on'.

Phrase (ii) is the only phrase with this correction, and thus all other phrases are eliminated.

Hence, the correct answer is option c).

question:
Which of the following phrases (A), (B), and (C) given below the sentence should replace the phrase printed in bold to make the sentence grammatically correct? Choose the best option among the five given alternatives that reflects the correct phrase(s) to be used in the sentence.

Afghanistan can be counted among those countries that has impacted severe with terrorism.

A. Have been impacted severely

B. Have suffered daily

C. Had suffering daily
solution:
The sentence is given in Passive voice in which 'Afghanistan' is among various countries that are being affected by terrorism. 'That' is a relative pronoun and verb after relative pronoun depends on the immediate subject which is 'countries'. So, both A and B can replace the given phrase because the usage of the plural verb 'have' is apt with the plural noun 'countries'. Phrase C is eliminated because 'had' should have been followed by past participle but 'suffering' is a present participle.

Hence, option (e) is correct.

NOTE/-

Relative pronouns: A relative pronoun is used to connect a clause or phrase to a noun or pronoun. The clause modifies, or describes, the noun. The most common relative pronouns are who, whom, whose, which, and that. For example: She is the girl who received the award for bravery from our Home Minister.

Participle: A word formed from a verb (e.g. going, gone, being, been) and used as an adjective (e.g. working woman, burnt toast) or a noun (e.g. good breeding). In English participles are also used to make compound verb forms (e.g. is going, has been). Consider the sentences given below:

Dancing at the party, the women fell on the ground.

Encouraged by her parents, Rita went on to pursue her passion.

The highlighted word in the first sentence is of the form Verb + ing and is used as a present participle. It is used to denote an action that is going on or incomplete or imperfect.

The highlighted word in the second sentence is of the form verb + ed. It is used as a past participle. It denotes a completed action or state of the thing spoken of.

A past participle ends with the following: -ed, -d, -t, -en, or -n.

One should take great care and never get confused between a gerund and present participle. They use the same forms but perform different functions: a gerund is a verbal noun, while a present participle is a verbal adjective.

question:
In the given question, a word has been given and there are three ways in which the word has been used, in similar or different forms. You need to see which of the sentences has/have correctly used the highlighted word, and mark that as your answer.

Store

I. Our store is open for late-night shopping on Wednesdays.

II. They store the garden tools in a shed in the backyard.

III. Gold remains one of the most reliable store of wealth.
solution:
The highlighted word is used correctly in sentence I. It is used here as a noun with the meaning 'a large shop where you can buy many different types of goods'.

The highlighted word is used correctly in sentence II. It is used here as a verb with the meaning 'to put or keep things for use in the future'.

In sentence III, the usage of this highlighted word is incorrect grammatically. The phrase 'one of the' should be followed by a plural noun, whereas 'store' is a singular noun. Hence, its plural form 'stores' would be correct to use in its place.

Hence, option (a) is the answer.

question:
In the given question, a word has been given and there are three ways in which the word has been used, in similar or different forms. You need to see which of the sentences has/have correctly used the highlighted word, and mark that as your answer.

Write

I. Write down the advice of him that loves you, though you like it not at present.

II. Taking a pen in her hand, she began to write.

III. Is it all write to park my car there?
solution:
The use of 'write' is correct in sentences I and II. However, the use of 'right (correct/true)' in place of 'write' would be correct in sentence III which suggests that it is correct to park at that point.

So, I and II are correct sentences.

Hence, option (e) is correct.

question:
In the following question, three sentences are given, revolving around the same theme or idea. Decide which of the sentences are grammatically and meaningfully correct and mark the answer accordingly.

I. Users with older Android smartphones miss out on a number of useful features.

II. Older Android smartphones' users misses on a lot of use of useful features.

III. A number of useful features are missed out by users with older Android smartphones.
solution: II: Subject-verb agreement mismatch ('Users' will take plural form of the verb 'miss' i.e. 'miss' itself); therefore, II is eliminated. I and III are grammatically correct; hence, B is the correct answer.

question:
In the sentence given below, some words have been underlined, which may or may not be correctly placed (grammatically or contextually). Rearrange the words to make the sentence grammatically correct.

She was so entranced(1) by the vintage(2) diamond ring that she couldn't delight(3) asking the jeweller to see it up close, much to the owner's resist(4).
solution:
Entranced: Filled with wonder and delight, holding their entire attention.

Vintage: Denoting something of high quality, especially something from the past.

Delight: Great pleasure or joy.

Resist: To withstand the action or effect of something.

"Delight" is not appropriate at its place. It does not fit here contextually as the sentence already mentions that she was filled with wonder on seeing the vintage diamond ring. So, "couldn't delight" gives an opposite meaning.

Couldn't resist asking: "Resist" appropriately describes the action of being unable to hold back from asking.

"Resist" (verb) is not appropriate at its place as the possessive noun "owner's" requires a noun after it.

Much to the owner's delight: "Delight" (noun) appropriately describes the owner's pleasure in seeing her interest.

Therefore, 4 and 3 need swapping. Hence, (b) is the correct answer.

The final sentence: She was so entranced by the vintage diamond ring that she couldn't resist asking the jeweller to see it up close, much to the owner's delight.

Note: Possessive nouns are types of nouns that show ownership or connection. All nouns become possessive nouns with the addition of an apostrophe and a suffix - the letter "s" - at the end of the word. However, when a plural noun ends in the letter "s," the possessive form of the word only requires the use of an apostrophe at the end. Possessive nouns can be tricky because they function like adjectives by modifying another noun or pronoun in the sentence. E.g., "Timmy's dog is cute."

question:
In the sentence given below, some words have been underlined, which may or may not be correctly placed (grammatically or contextually). Rearrange the words to make the sentence grammatically correct.

The sinister nefarious (1) on the villain's face as he revealed (2) his plan sent a shiver down everyone's spines, signalling that something smirk (3) and perilous (4) was about to unfold.
solution:
The pair of words that needs to be interchanged to make the sentence grammatically and contextually correct is '1-3'. In the sentence, the adjective 'sinister' (evil or wicked) is used to qualify a noun. But the word 'nefarious' (that comes after 'sinister') is an adjective, not a noun. So, we need to interchange the word 'nefarious' (extremely wicked) with a noun that can be qualified by the adjective 'sinister'. Among the underlined words, only 'smirk' (smile) is a noun. Accordingly, it is appropriate to interchange the word 'nefarious' (1) with the word 'smirk' (3). There is no need to interchange other words as they are already placed correctly in the sentence. 'Perilous' means dangerous. Hence, (e) is the correct answer.

The correct sentence is: The sinister smirk on the villain's face as he revealed his plan sent a shiver down everyone's spines, signalling that something nefarious and perilous was about to unfold.

Note:

Qualifiers: A word or phrase that limits the meaning of another word or phrase or makes it less general. 'Adverbs' and 'adjectives' are qualifiers.

question:
In the sentence given below, some words have been underlined, which may or may not be correctly placed (grammatically or contextually). Rearrange the words to make the sentence grammatically correct.

The ruthless impeccable (1) in the critic's review sought (2) to tear down the artist's venom (3) work with relentless (4) criticism.
solution:
The pair of words that needs to be interchanged to make the sentence grammatically and contextually correct is '1-3'. In the sentence, the adjective 'ruthless' (cruel) is used to qualify a noun. But the word 'impeccable' (that comes after 'ruthless') is an adjective, not a noun. So, we need to interchange the word 'impeccable' (faultless) with a noun that can be qualified by the adjective 'ruthless'. Among the underlined words, only 'venom' (something resembling or suggesting poison in its effect; spite; malice) is a noun. Accordingly, it is appropriate to interchange the word 'impeccable' (1) with the word 'venom' (3). There is no need to interchange other words as they are already placed correctly in the sentence. 'relentless' means unyieldingly severe, strict, or harsh. Hence, (e) is the correct answer.

The correct sentence is: The ruthless venom in the critic's review sought to tear down the artist's impeccable work with relentless criticism.

Note:

Qualifiers: A word or phrase that limits the meaning of another word or phrase or makes it less general. 'Adverbs' and 'adjectives' are qualifiers.

question:
In the given question, a sentence has been broken into five parts and the parts are jumbled. Choose the option which provides the correct way to re-arrange the parts to form a grammatically and contextually meaningful sentence.

A. used in

B. human resource

C. equity theory is

D. management

E. the parlance of
solution:
Part C has to be the first part because parts A and D, though can initiate the sentence, they cannot accommodate other parts to make a meaningful sentence. Part C is followed by part A which denotes the verb of the sentence and how is it related to part C. It is followed by part E which describes how 'equity theory' is used and it is followed by the pair BD which denotes the area or segment [i.e., 'human resource management'] in which 'equity theory' is used. So, the final order of the parts of the sentence is CAEBD.

The correct sentence after rearrangement is: Equity theory is used in the parlance of human resource management.

Hence, the correct answer is option (e).

Note - 'Parlance' means 'a particular way of speaking or using words, especially a way common to those with a particular job or interest'.

question:
In the given question, a sentence has been broken into five parts and the parts are jumbled. Choose the option which provides the correct way to re-arrange the parts to form a grammatically and contextually meaningful sentence.

A. income of

B. is a tax imposed

C. a company

D. on the net

E. corporation tax
solution:
EB is a pair which introduces and defines the subject of the sentence which is 'corporation tax', so it comes first in the order. It is followed by the triplet which is DAC ['net income of a company' forms a meaningful phrase] which denotes the thing on which the tax is imposed. So, the final order of the parts of the sentence is EBDAC.

The correct sentence after rearrangement is: Corporation tax is a tax imposed on the net income of a company.

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

question:
In the given question, a sentence has been broken into five parts and the parts are jumbled. Choose the option which provides the correct way to re-arrange the parts to form a grammatically and contextually meaningful sentence.

A. of its introduction

B. the bill has to

C. the Parliament

D. be passed by

E. within 75 days
solution:
Part B has to be the first part which hints at the premise of the sentence and ends with the preposition 'to' which needs to be followed by either a base verb or a noun. Accordingly, Part D starts with the base verb. So, part D which indicates the action that requires to be done comes second in the order. Part D ends with the preposition 'by' which has to be followed by a noun to denote the doer of the action and part C which denotes the noun 'the Parliament' is the most suitable part to follow it. EA is a pair which indicates the time limit before which a bill needs to be passed by the Parliament. So, it comes as the last part of the sentence. So, the final order of the given parts of a sentence is BDCEA.

The correct sentence after rearrangement is: The bill has to be passed by the Parliament within 75 days of its introduction.

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

Note:

A Preposition is a word placed before a noun or a pronoun or a noun equivalent (pronoun, adverb, gerund, infinitive, adverbial clause, or any clause that can be used as the object of the preposition) and shows a relationship in space or time or a logical relationship between two or more people, places, or things in a sentence.

Examples

I. The teacher scolded the child for being late.

II. We're going to a party.

· The words in bold are called prepositions because they normally take position before (pre) a noun/pronoun or a noun equivalent (pronoun, adverb, gerund, infinitive, adverbial clause, or any clause that can be used as the object of the preposition.

· The noun/pronoun which is used with a preposition is called its Object.

question:
In the following question, the sentence is divided into five parts and the parts are jumbled randomly. Read the following parts of the sentence and choose the correct order of the parts of the sentence as your answer.

A. mining towns earlier

B. that then

C. became ski

D. they were

E. mountains and resorts
solution:
The given parts of a sentence talk about a converted 'ski mountain' range. Part D has to come first to denote the ski mountains and it is followed by part A which indicates what those ski mountains were before they got converted into ski mountains. Part B acts as a link between part A and the pair CE, in which the pair denotes the changeover that happened to the mining towns. So, part B follows part A and it is followed by the pair CE in the order. Therefore, the correct order of the parts of the sentence is DABCE.

The correct sentence after rearrangement is: They were mining towns earlier that then became ski mountains and resorts.

Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

question:
Directions:

Directions : In the following passage, some of the words have been left out and replaced by a blank represented by an alphabet. First read the passage and try to understand what it is about. Then fill in the blanks as per the questions given.

Water is an essential component of survival on Earth. Existence would not have been possible in the absence of water. Just like air, water is equally an essential ___(A)___. All the life forms on the Earth's surface - animals, plants, insects, human beings require water for consumption and other purposes in the functioning of their daily lives. Fresh and ___(B)___ water is necessary for use and survival. Apart from drinking, water can be consumed for other purposes. Water is also used for washing, cooking, and agricultural purposes. Water resources are being massively destroyed in the past few years. On the face of global warming and a rising world population, it is very ___(C)___ to save water as much as possible. The need to conserve and save water is essential, and everyone should be aware of it. To avoid a shortage of water, everyone should participate equally and ___(D)___ misusing and over-using water resources whenever and wherever possible. Currently, the most dangerous threat that the Earth faces is the shortage of freshwater. While some of the countries have water resources in abundance to provide to their people, many places all across the globe are faced with an immense lack of enough water resources due to the geography of the countries. Natural causes can be ___(E)___ to this scarcity.



Which of the following words can replace the blank marked as (A) in the passage?
solution: The blank requires a noun which is qualified by the adjective 'essential'. According to this 'reinforce' (strengthen or support) is eliminated as it is a verb. The noun 'spot' is a misfit in this sentence as the author talks about water. Similarly, 'homage' (special honour or respect shown publicly) does not agree with the context of the sentence. So, option (d) is also eliminated. In this sentence the author tries to relate water with air. Therefore, 'storage' is not a best option to choose. The noun 'element' is the one that fits correctly in the sentence. Hence, option (b) is the correct answer.

The adjective 'potable' (safe to drink; drinkable) is the one that fits correctly in the given sentence as drinkable water is necessary for life. Hence, option (e) is the correct answer.

question:
Directions:

Directions : In the following passage, some of the words have been left out and replaced by a blank represented by an alphabet. First read the passage and try to understand what it is about. Then fill in the blanks as per the questions given.

Water is an essential component of survival on Earth. Existence would not have been possible in the absence of water. Just like air, water is equally an essential ___(A)___. All the life forms on the Earth's surface - animals, plants, insects, human beings require water for consumption and other purposes in the functioning of their daily lives. Fresh and ___(B)___ water is necessary for use and survival. Apart from drinking, water can be consumed for other purposes. Water is also used for washing, cooking, and agricultural purposes. Water resources are being massively destroyed in the past few years. On the face of global warming and a rising world population, it is very ___(C)___ to save water as much as possible. The need to conserve and save water is essential, and everyone should be aware of it. To avoid a shortage of water, everyone should participate equally and ___(D)___ misusing and over-using water resources whenever and wherever possible. Currently, the most dangerous threat that the Earth faces is the shortage of freshwater. While some of the countries have water resources in abundance to provide to their people, many places all across the globe are faced with an immense lack of enough water resources due to the geography of the countries. Natural causes can be ___(E)___ to this scarcity.



Which of the following words can replace the blank marked as (C) in the passage?
solution:
The blank requires an adjective since it is preceded by the adverb 'very' which requires an adverb or adjective followed by it. In this case we cannot use an adverb as there is no verb/adjective/another adverb to modify.

The sentence talks about saving water. So, we need an adjective appropriate to the context of the sentence. The word 'judgement' is eliminated as it is a noun. The adjective 'sentient' (able to perceive or feel things) is a misfit in this sentence as the adjective is not related to the context of the sentence. The passage states that water is an essential component in our daily life. Therefore, saving water is not 'minor' (lesser in importance) or 'insignificant' (too small or unimportant to be worth consideration). So, options (b) and (c) are eliminated. The adjective 'crucial' (of great importance) is the one that fits correctly in the sentence. Hence, option (d) is the correct answer.

question:
Directions:

Directions : In the following passage, some of the words have been left out and replaced by a blank represented by an alphabet. First read the passage and try to understand what it is about. Then fill in the blanks as per the questions given.

Water is an essential component of survival on Earth. Existence would not have been possible in the absence of water. Just like air, water is equally an essential ___(A)___. All the life forms on the Earth's surface - animals, plants, insects, human beings require water for consumption and other purposes in the functioning of their daily lives. Fresh and ___(B)___ water is necessary for use and survival. Apart from drinking, water can be consumed for other purposes. Water is also used for washing, cooking, and agricultural purposes. Water resources are being massively destroyed in the past few years. On the face of global warming and a rising world population, it is very ___(C)___ to save water as much as possible. The need to conserve and save water is essential, and everyone should be aware of it. To avoid a shortage of water, everyone should participate equally and ___(D)___ misusing and over-using water resources whenever and wherever possible. Currently, the most dangerous threat that the Earth faces is the shortage of freshwater. While some of the countries have water resources in abundance to provide to their people, many places all across the globe are faced with an immense lack of enough water resources due to the geography of the countries. Natural causes can be ___(E)___ to this scarcity.



Which of the following words can replace the blank marked as (D) in the passage?
solution:
The blank requires a verb to follow the parallelism with another verb 'participate'. According to this 'proposal' (a plan or suggestion) and 'moment' are eliminated as they are nouns. The sentence states that everyone should be careful with the usage of water to avoid the shortage of water. The verb 'advocate' (to publicly support or suggest an idea, development, or way of doing something) and 'encourage' are misfits in this sentence as no one should be encourage or support misuse of water. The author wants to convey that people should avoid misuse of water. So, options (c) and (a) are eliminated. The verb 'thwart' (to stop something from happening or someone from doing something) is the one that fits correctly in the sentence. Hence, option (d) is the correct answer.

NOTE:

Parallelism: In grammar, parallelism, also known as parallel structure or parallel construction, is a balance within one or more sentences of similar phrases or clauses that have the same grammatical structure. Given below is an example which shows a sentence in two forms (parallel in structure and lacking parallelism): Lacking parallelism: Prerna likes cooking, dancing and to sing. Parallel: Prerna likes cooking, dancing and singing.

question:
Directions:

Directions : In the following passage, some of the words have been left out and replaced by a blank represented by an alphabet. First read the passage and try to understand what it is about. Then fill in the blanks as per the questions given.

Water is an essential component of survival on Earth. Existence would not have been possible in the absence of water. Just like air, water is equally an essential ___(A)___. All the life forms on the Earth's surface - animals, plants, insects, human beings require water for consumption and other purposes in the functioning of their daily lives. Fresh and ___(B)___ water is necessary for use and survival. Apart from drinking, water can be consumed for other purposes. Water is also used for washing, cooking, and agricultural purposes. Water resources are being massively destroyed in the past few years. On the face of global warming and a rising world population, it is very ___(C)___ to save water as much as possible. The need to conserve and save water is essential, and everyone should be aware of it. To avoid a shortage of water, everyone should participate equally and ___(D)___ misusing and over-using water resources whenever and wherever possible. Currently, the most dangerous threat that the Earth faces is the shortage of freshwater. While some of the countries have water resources in abundance to provide to their people, many places all across the globe are faced with an immense lack of enough water resources due to the geography of the countries. Natural causes can be ___(E)___ to this scarcity.



Which of the following words can replace the blank marked as (E) in the passage?
solution:
The blank requires a verb in its past/present participle form after the construct '..can be..'. According to this option (c) is eliminated as it is a base form of verb. Option (e) is also eliminated as 'meagre' (lacking in quantity or quality) is an adjective. The verb 'eliminated' is a misfit in this sentence as the sentence states that natural cause can be a reason for scarcity of water in some of the nations. So, we cannot eliminate natural causes. So, option (a) is eliminated. We don't want to escalate the natural causes of scarcity of water. So, the verb 'optimized' (make the best or most effective use of) is incorrect in this context. Therefore, option (d) is eliminated. The verb 'attributed' (to say or think that something is the result of a particular thing) is the one that fits correctly in the sentence as its use conveys that the scarcity of water in some of the countries are escalated by the natural causes. Hence, option (b) is the correct answer.

NOTE:

Participle: A word formed from a verb (e.g. going, gone, being, been) and used as an adjective (e.g. working woman, burnt toast) or a noun (e.g. good breeding). In English participles are also used to make compound verb forms (e.g. is going, has been). Consider the sentences given below:

Dancing at the party, the women fell on the ground.

Encouraged by her parents, Rita went on to pursue her passion.

The highlighted word in the first sentence is of the form Verb + ing and is used as a present participle. It is used to denote an action that is going on or incomplete or imperfect.

The highlighted word in the second sentence is of the form verb + ed. It is used as a past participle. It denotes completed action or state of the thing spoken of.

A past participle ends with the following: -ed, -d, -t, -en, or -n.

question:
Directions:

Directions : Read the following passage carefully and answer the following questions.

Scientists have developed a "smart bandage" that can signal the type of bacterial infection it's protecting, just like a traffic light, as well as release the right type of drugs on demand. The researchers behind the design hope it could help to fight back against antibiotic resistance, as well as heal wounds more quickly. The traffic light system works just like you'd expect: Green means no bacteria or a low concentration of bacteria, yellow means drug-sensitive (DS) bacteria responsive to standard antibiotics (and triggers antibiotic release), and red means drug-resistant (DR) bacteria that need extra help to be wiped out. The stronger the colour, the higher the concentration of bacteria.

In testing the bandage on mice, the research team was able to successfully treat both DS and DR E. coli infections using the new method. If drug resistance is detected, an intense beam of light can be used to activate the release of a highly reactive species of oxygen to weaken the bacteria, making them more susceptible to the antibiotic in the material. Antibiotics are released as soon as the infection is detected, and because antibiotic resistance can also be caught, it means additional treatments can be applied before the bacteria have a chance to mutate and defend themselves further.

Sensing bacterial infections and monitoring drug resistance are very important for the selection of treatment options. However, the common methods of sensing resistance are limited by time, the requirement for professional personnel, and expensive instruments. Moreover, the abuse of antibiotics causes the accelerated process of bacterial resistance.

It's easy to see how a simple bandage and light could overcome some of these limitations - the basic wound dressing can be easily transported and distributed, and attacks bacteria immediately, without any special equipment or personnel required. Treatment doesn't have to wait for a doctor to make a diagnosis, and the bandage can get the right sort of drugs applied at the earliest opportunity. Only a small amount of testing has been carried out so far, but there's plenty of potential here. What's more, the person wearing the bandage gets real-time feedback on what's happening with the infection, if there's an infection at all. The researchers say it offers numerous benefits over existing treatments that make use of light, including photodynamic therapy or PDT.

Compared with traditional PDT-based antibacterial strategies, this design can alleviate off-target side effects, maximise therapeutic efficacy, and track the drug resistance in real time with the naked eye. We've been seeing quite a few upgrades to the traditional bandage in recent years, thanks to advances in science - like the nano-fibre mesh that attracts bacteria and draws some of it out, speeding up the healing process. Then there's the novel bandage for treating burns, which stops bacteria from multiplying and lowers the risk of infection. Efforts to improve bandages continue - and now we've got a bandage that not only releases antibiotics but tells the patient exactly what's going on too.



According to the passage, which of the following is/are correctly matched pairs regarding the functioning of smart bandage?

I. Green - no bacteria or a low concentration of bacteria

II. Red - triggers antibiotic release

III. Yellow - bacteria is drug resistant and need extra help to be wiped out
solution: The 3rd sentence of the passage gives the details of the way the smart bandage functions. Only I is the correctly matched pair; II & III are incorrectly matched. Hence, option (c) is the correct answer.

According to the passage, which of the following words represents the closest antonym of the word 'alleviate'?
solution:
'Alleviate' - make (suffering, deficiency, or a problem) less severe. 'Exacerbate' - make (a problem, bad situation, or negative feeling) worse. Thus, 'exacerbate' is the correct antonym of the word 'alleviate'. Hence, option (d) is the correct answer.

'Reduce' - make smaller or less in amount, degree, or size; 'soften'- make or become less severe; 'quieten' - make or become quiet and calm; 'blunt' - weaken or reduce the force of (something). These words are the synonyms of the word 'alleviate'.

However, the common methods of sensing resistance are limited by time, the requirement for professional personnel, and expensive instruments. Moreover, the abuse of antibiotics causes the accelerated process of bacterial resistance.

It's easy to see how a simple bandage and light could overcome some of these limitations - the basic wound dressing can be easily transported and distributed, and attacks bacteria immediately, without any special equipment or personnel required. Treatment doesn't have to wait for a doctor to make a diagnosis, and the bandage can get the right sort of drugs applied at the earliest opportunity. Only a small amount of testing has been carried out so far, but there's plenty of potential here. What's more, the person wearing the bandage gets real-time feedback on what's happening with the infection, if there's an infection at all. The researchers say it offers numerous benefits over existing treatments that make use of light, including photodynamic therapy or PDT.

Compared with traditional PDT-based antibacterial strategies, this design can alleviate off-target side effects, maximise therapeutic efficacy, and track the drug resistance in real time with the naked eye. We've been seeing quite a few upgrades to the traditional bandage in recent years, thanks to advances in science - like the nano-fibre mesh that attracts bacteria and draws some of it out, speeding up the healing process. Then there's the novel bandage for treating burns, which stops bacteria from multiplying and lowers the risk of infection. Efforts to improve bandages continue - and now we've got a bandage that not only releases antibiotics but tells the patient exactly what's going on too.



According to the passage, which of the following word would be synonymous with the word 'mutate' as used in the passage?
solution:
'Mutate' - change in form or nature; (biology) undergo or cause to undergo change in a gene or genes. 'Evolve' - to change or develop gradually. Thus, 'evolve' is the correct synonym of the word 'mutate'. Hence, option (c) is the correct answer.

'Construct' - build or make (something, typically a building, road, or machine); 'cast' - throw (something) forcefully in a specified direction; 'pacify' - quell the anger, agitation, or excitement of; 'infect' - contaminate; affect (a person, organism, etc.) with a disease-causing organism. None of these words are a synonym of the word 'mutate'.

question: Maximum marks in an examination is 'x'. A student got marks which is 330 less than the maximum marks and failed by 5 marks. If minimum passing marks is 35% of maximum marks, then find the value of 'x'.
solution:
According to question,

Passing marks = 35% of x

Marks obtained = x - 330

Passing marks = x - 330 + 5 = x - 325

35% of x = x - 325

7x/20 = x - 325

7x = 20x - 6500

13x = 6500

x = 500

question: Ratio of number of men to that of women in a factory is 5:6. 2 people are selected simultaneously. Probability that both of them are women is 2/7. Find the number of people working in the factory.
solution:
Let no. of men and that of women in factory be 5k and 6k respectively.

Total number of people in factory = 5k + 6k = 11k

Probability that both are women = 6kC2/11kC2 = 2/7

=> 6k!/(2!*(6k-2)!) * 2!*(11k-2)!/11k! = 2/7

=> 6k(6k-1)/(11k*(11k-1)) = 2/7

=> 21(6k-1) = 11(11k-1)

=> 5k = 10

=> k = 2

Total number of people in factory = 11k = 11*2 = 22

question: Eeti, Ketin and John together can complete the whole work in (144/13) days while Ketin alone can complete the whole work in 48 days and Ketin is 25% less efficient than John, then in how many days Eeti alone can complete the whole work?
solution:
Ketin alone can complete the whole work in 48 days

John alone can complete the whole work in = 48 * 75/100 = 36 days

Eeti, Ketin and John together can complete the whole work in (144/13)

Eeti alone can complete the whole work = 1/(13/144 - 1/48 - 1/36) = 24 days

question:
Directions:

Directions : Study the information given below and answer the following questions:

Below data is given regarding the number of mobiles and laptops sold by four companies in a week:

The ratio of number of mobiles sold by company A and B is 7: 8 respectively and the ratio of number of laptops sold by company C and D is 2: 3 respectively. The number of mobiles sold by company D is 33(1/3)% of the number of mobiles sold by company C and the number of laptops sold by company A and B are 3500 and 2500 respectively. The number of mobiles sold by company A and number of laptops sold by D are 112% and 96% of the number of laptops sold by company B respectively. The total number of mobiles and laptops sold by C is 6100.



What is the ratio of total number of mobile and laptops sold by company A to that of by company D?
solution:
The number of laptops sold by company A and B are 3500 and 2500, respectively.

The number of mobiles sold by company A = (112/100) * 2500 = 2800

The number of laptops sold by company D = (96/100) * 2500 = 2400

The ratio of the number of mobiles sold by company A and B is 7: 8

The number of mobiles sold by company B = 2800 * 8/7 = 3200

and the ratio of the number of laptops sold by company C and D is 2: 3.

The number of laptops sold by company C = 2400 * 2/3 = 1600

The total number of mobiles and laptops sold by C is 6100.

So, number of mobiles sold by C = 6100 - 1600 = 4500

The number of mobiles sold by company D is 33(1/3)% of the number of mobiles sold by company C

The number of mobiles sold by company D = (1/3) * 4500 = 1500


Required ratio = (2800 + 3500): (1500 + 2400) = 6300: 3900 = 21: 13

The number of laptops sold by company D is what percentage more or less than the number of mobiles sold by the same company?
solution:
The number of laptops sold by company A and B are 3500 and 2500, respectively.

The number of mobiles sold by company A = (112/100) * 2500 = 2800

The number of laptops sold by company D = (96/100) * 2500 = 2400

The ratio of the number of mobiles sold by company A and B is 7: 8

The number of mobiles sold by company B = 2800 * 8/7 = 3200

and the ratio of the number of laptops sold by company C and D is 2: 3.

The number of laptops sold by company C = 2400 * 2/3 = 1600

The total number of mobiles and laptops sold by C is 6100.

So, number of mobiles sold by C = 6100 - 1600 = 4500

The number of mobiles sold by company D is 33(1/3)% of the number of mobiles sold by company C

The number of mobiles sold by company D = (1/3) * 4500 = 1500


Required % = ((2400 - 1500)/1500) * 100 = 60%

The ratio of the radius of circle and the side of the square is 7:8 and the circumference of circle is 396cm. Find the perimeter of the square.
solution:
Circumference of circle = 2∏r (r= radius)

396 = 2 X 22/7 X r

r = 63 cm

Radius of circle/ side of square = 7/8

63/ side of square = 7/8

Side of square = 72 cm

The perimeter of the square = 4 X side of square = 4 X 72 = 288cm

question: Ajit and Amit start a business with Rs. 54000 and Rs. 90000 respectively. If after 'X' months from the start of the business, Ajit increased in investment by Rs. 18000 and after a year, the profit is divided in the ratio is 2: 3, then find the value of 'X'.
solution:
A/Q

[54000 * X + 72000 * (12 - X)]/ 90000 * 12 = 2/3

[3X + 4 (12 - X)]/ [5 * 12] = 2/3

[3X + 48 - 4X]/ 20 = 2/1

48 - X = 40

X = 8

Hence, the required value = 8 months

question: After 5 years, the ratio of ages of Jeff and Tim will be 7:10 and after 10 years the ratio of ages of Jeff and Tom will be 4:7. Tim was 12 years old, 3 years before Jeff's birth. What is the average of their present ages?
solution:
Let the present ages of Jeff, Tim and Tom be 'x', 'y' and 'z' years respectively.

Given, (x + 5)/(y + 5) = 7/10

10x + 50 = 7y + 35

7y - 10x = 15..(i)

Also, (x + 10)/(z + 10) = 4/7

4z + 40 = 7x + 70

4z - 7x = 30..(ii)

Also, Age of Tim when Jeff was born = y - x

Age of Tim 3 years before Jeff's birth = 12

y - x - 3 = 12

y - x = 15..(iii)

10*(iii) - (i) gives,

3y = 135

y = 45

x = 45 - 15 = 30

From (ii),

z = (30 + 7*30)/4 = 60

Average of their present ages = (30 + 45 + 60)/3 = 45 years

question:
Find the wrong number from the given series.

5, 7, 11, 19, 35, 65, 131
solution:
In this series, each previous term is first multiplied by 2 and them subtracted by 3 to get the next term of the series:

(5 * 2) - 3 = 7

(7 * 2) - 3 = 11

(11 * 2) - 3 = 19

(19 * 2) - 3 = 35

(35 * 2) - 3 = 67 (Not 65)

(67 * 2) - 3 = 131

question:
The question given below consists of a question and two statements I and II given below it. You have to decide whether the data provided in the statements are sufficient to answer the question.

Six people P, Q, R, S, T and U were born in six different consecutive years starting from 1980 to 1985. Two people were born between Q and P. S was born immediately before T. Who was born in 1984?

I. Only one person was born between T and U. R was born after Q.

option_2: If the data in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone are not sufficient to answer the question
option_3: If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question
option_4: If the data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question
option_5: If the data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question
solution:
Considering statement I alone:

Only one person was born between T and U. R was born after Q.

Two people were born between Q and P. S was born immediately before T.

question:
Two statements numbered I and II are given below. You have to decide whether the data provided in the statements are sufficient to answer the question.

Seven people are seated in a linear row facing north. D is seated third to the right of C. A is seated to the immediate left of B. D is seated at one of the ends of the row. How many people are seated between B and D?

I. F is seated third to the right of A. C is seated to the immediate left of F.

II. D is seated adjacent to G. E is seated to the immediate left of A.
option_1: If the data in statement I alone are sufficient to answer the question while the data in statement II alone are not sufficient to answer the question
option_2: If the data in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question
option_3: If the data in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question while the data in statement, I alone are not sufficient to answer the question
option_4: If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone are sufficient to answer the question
option_5: If the data in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question
solution:
We have:

Considering statement I:

F is seated third to the right of A. C is seated to the immediate left of F.

D is seated third to the right of C. A is seated to the immediate left of B.

D is seated at one of the ends of the row.

Considering statement II:

D is seated adjacent to G. E is seated to the immediate left of A.

D is seated third to the right of C. A is seated to the immediate left of B.

D is seated at one of the ends of the row.

So both the statement are sufficient alone. Three people are seated between B and D.

E prefers Aldo. E faces the girl who sits second to the right of the one who prefers Fendi. A faces G, who sits immediate to the right of the one who prefers Dior. Neither A nor H prefers Fendi. solution:
Eight girls - A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H who prefer different brands are sitting in two parallel rows. Girls sitting in row 1 are facing south and prefer Gucci, Aldo, Guess and Dior bags while girls sitting in row 2 are facing north and prefers Chanel, Coach, Prada and Fendi bags.

E prefers Aldo.

Girls who prefer Chanel and Fendi are not neighbours of the girl who prefers Prada.

D prefers Guess.

H prefers Coach brand and faces D.

question:
Directions:

Directions : Study the following information and answer the related questions.

Certain number of people are sitting around a rectangular table, all are facing towards the centre. Only a few positions are known.

Q sits at one of the corners. Only three people are seated between Q and K, who is facing A. B, who is facing M, sits in the middle of one of the widths of the table. Not more than 23 people are seated around the table. C sits thirteenth to the right of A. Number of people seated on each width is half of the number of people seated on each length. One person is seated on each corner. N is seated sixth to the left of C and is facing O.



In which position is B seated with respect to Q?
solution:
C sits thirteenth to the right of A.

Not more than 23 people are seated around the table.

Therefore, at least 14 and at most 23 people are seated around the table.

Number of people seated on each width is half of the number of people seated on each length.

#People seated on each width#People seated on each length#People seated on all the 4 corners#People seated around the tableRemarks
1241 X 2 + 2 X 2 + 4 = 10Less than 14
2442 X 2 + 4 X 2 + 4 = 16Possible
3643 X 2 + 6 X 2 + 4 = 22Possible
4844 X 2 + 8 X 2 + 4 = 28Exceeding 23

Therefore, either 16 (case I) or 22 (case II) people are seated around the table.

Q sits at one of the corners.

Only three people are seated between Q and K, who is facing A.

C sits thirteenth to the right of A.

B, who is facing M, sits in the middle of one of the widths of the table.

Thus, case IA and IB are invalid.

Therefore, 22 people are seated around the table.

N is seated sixth to the left of C and is facing O.

Thus, only case IIA-1 and IIA-2 are valid.


Exact position of B is not known.

Study the following information and answer the given question.

B is to the West of A. C is to the South of B. D, which is to the South of A, is to the East of C. E, which is on the same horizontal line with A, is to the North-East of D.

E is to the ______________________ of C.
solution:
B is to the West of A.

C is to the South of B. D, which is to the South of A, is to the East of C.

E, which is on the same horizontal line with A, is to the North-East of D.

E is to the North-East of C.

question:
Directions:

Directions : Eight members of a family consists of three generations in which either both or none of the parents are alive. There were an equal number of males and females in the family. P is the only son of M who is the grandfather of O. S is the brother of R. Q is the uncle of T. N has two children but is not married to M. M has only one child.



How O is related to N?
solution:
P is the only son of M who is the grandfather of O. M has only one child.

S is the brother of R. Q is the uncle of T. N has two children but not married to M.


O is the daughter of N.
